Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Earring
Description: This is a circular earring, one of the surfaces of which is almost entirely smoothened. The ring is hollow and bevel-edged. On the exterior surface, the bevelled angle bears a delicate twisted rope moulding decoration applied on the preserved contour. The rope moulding decoration is in the shape of a thin braid 1 mm wide. The earring could have been suspended by means of the central opening, approximately 7 mms in diameter.
